bibl.title: Letter from Wilbur A. Sawyer to Philip Showalter Hench, May 6, 1948

div1.p: Sawyer tells Hench that he is writing to Strode in an attempt to trace a missing book belonging to Rodriguez Leon. He sends Hench a copy of this letter. Sawyer remembers receiving another reprint from Agramonte, but does not remember this missing book. He promises to make every effort to either find or replace the publication.

My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I am acknowledging your letter of April
30, 1948, regarding the lost book of Senora
Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon. I am com-
municating with Dr. George K. Strode, Director,
International Health Division, The Rockefeller
Foundation, in the hope that he can help trace
the book or determine its identity.

I remember the first correspondence with
Dr. Agramonte as the result of which he sent
us a reprint on his animal work. I have no
recollection of the book she refers to and prob-
ably never saw it. If we can find out its
identity, I hope that we can arrange to send
her a new copy of the book, if the old one cannot
be traced.

Dr. Crawford has died, but Dr. Strode
may have the address of Dr. DuBois.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Wilbur A. Sawyer,
Chairman, Program Committee. Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
